questions.question: Do you notice that you spend more time online than you intended?
Do you neglect household chores in order to wander online longer?
Do you prefer being online to intimate communication with your partner?
Do you meet Internet users while you are online?
Are you annoyed because others are interested in the amount of time you spend online?
Do you notice that you have stopped making progress in your studies or work because you spend too much time online?
Do you check your email before you do something else that is more necessary?
Do you notice that your productivity is declining due to the Internet craze?
Are you defensive and secretive when people ask you what you do online?
Do you block disturbing thoughts about your real life with thoughts about the Internet?
Do you find yourself looking forward to going online again?
Do you feel that life without the Internet is boring, empty and joyless?
Do you swear, shout, or otherwise express your frustration when someone tries to distract you from being online?
Do you neglect sleep by staying up late on the Internet?
Are you looking forward to doing something online while offline?
Do you say to yourself: "Just a minute" while you are online?
Are you failing to reduce your time spent online?
Are you trying to hide the amount of time you spend online?
Instead of going out with your friends, choose the Internet?
Do you experience depression, depression, or nervousness when you are offline and note that this state passes as soon as you are online?
Do you feel euphoric, enlivened, excited while at the computer?
Do you need to spend more and more time at the computer to get the same experience?
Do you feel empty, depressed, irritated when you are not at the computer?
Have you ever neglected important things while you were busy at the computer, but not at work?
Do you spend more than 3 hours online a day?
If you mainly use your computer for work, do you chat during business hours or visit sites that are not related to work more than 2 times a day?
Do you download files from sites with pornographic content?
Do you think that it is easier to communicate with a person "online" than in person?
Have your friends or family members told you that you spend too much time 'online'?
Does the amount of time spent online interfere with your business activity?
Have you ever failed to limit your online time?
Does it happen that your fingers get tired from working on the keyboard or from clicking the mouse button?
Have you ever lied about the amount of time you spend online?
Have you ever had "carpal tunnel syndrome" (numbness and pain in the hand)?
Do you have back pain more often than once a week?
Do you ever have a feeling of dryness in your eyes?
Is the amount of time you spend online increasing?
Have you ever skipped a meal or eaten directly at the computer to stay online?
Have you ever neglected personal hygiene, such as shaving, combing your hair, etc., to spend this time at the computer?
Do you have any sleep disorders and / or have your sleep patterns changed since you started using the computer daily?
